attributes.action: Make the minimum wage for 18+ equal
attributes.additional_details: There's no difference between an 18 year old and a 23 year old. Both will put in the same effort within a workplace, both could have the same living circumstances, and yet one gets paid more than another. The difference of £2.35 an hour could make is massive. That's an extra £94 a week, £376 a month and £4,512 a year. That's enough to provide extra food, or electricity or anything to a struggling family. The same goes for apprentices who also do the same job and get paid minimal. Change it!
attributes.background: Since minimum wage has been introduced, it has never been equal for everyone. The segregations between 18-20, 21-22 and 23+ are outrageous. It is unfair to individuals who are of the younger age, but are still putting in the same amount of work from within a company.

rejection.details:
